text: Iron is a fundamental element that helps blood cells transport oxygen throughout the body. Most people receive sufficient amounts of iron through their regular diets, since many foods are high in iron; however, extra iron may be needed after a hemorrhage or when the body fails to produce enough red blood cells.

You must respond based strictly on the information in a provided passage. Do not incorporate any external knowledge or infer any details beyond what is given in the passage. Provide a concise summary of the following passage, covering the core pieces of information described.

Most people receive sufficient amounts of iron through their regular diets, since many foods are high in iron; however, extra iron may be needed after a hemorrhage or when the body fails to produce enough red blood cells.".
